title: Verify that proper error message is displayed when user tries to lock one seat which is already locked in another browser
custom_preconds:
Browser#1 - First lock
1.Open MPV application in one browser (B1)
2.Login with patron1 and navigate to Upgrade packages section
3.Select one order (Order#1) and navigate to availability
4.Select some seats from the availability and navigate to cart with Add to cart button

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Now open Open MPV application in another browser (B2)
2. Login with the same patron1 and navigate to Upgrade packages section
3. Select the same order (Order#1) and navigate to availability
4. Select some seats from the availability and navigate to cart with Add to cart button
5. Do the same in API flow
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login Should be successful
2. Success
3. Success
4. Proper error message should display:
An order associated with one or more tickets you are processing is currently locked by another action. Either complete the other action first or wait and try again.
5. Proper error message should display:
An order associated with one or more tickets you are processing is currently locked by another action. Either complete the other action first or wait and try again.

title: Verify that a patron with a specific trait can only relocate their seats at the specific time defined for the particular trait.
custom_preconds:
1.Create full package with a specific time to be eligible for seat relocation 
2.Create Half packages with a specific time to be eligible for seat relocation. 
3.Create a Patron with trait VIP and complete transactions with the above Full package and Half Package.
4.Create a Patron with trait GOLD and complete transactions with the above Full package and Half Package.
5.Create a Patron with trait NODONOR and complete transactions with the above Full package and Half Package.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV
2. Verify that the patron with trait VIP can relocate their seats at the exact time the packages become eligible for relocation for both the Full and Half package.
3. Verify that the patron with trait GOLD can relocate their seats at the exact time the packages become eligible for relocation for both the Full and Half package.
4. Verify that the patron with trait GOLD can relocate their seats 15 minutes after the package eligibility time is set for both the Full and Half package. 
5. Run the Patron Market Permission utility for the patron, setting the Allow Relocation permission accordingly.
6. Verify that the patron with trait NODONOR can relocate their seats at the exact time the packages become eligible for relocation for both the Full and Half package.
7. Verify that the patron with trait NODONOR can relocate their seats 24 hours after the package eligibility time is set for both the Full and Half package. 
8. Run the Patron Market Permission utility for the patron, setting the Allow Relocation permission accordingly.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login Should be successful
2. The patron with trait VIP should be able to relocate their seats at the exact time the packages become eligible for relocation.
3. Error should be displayed.

4. The patron with trait GOLD should be able to relocate their seats 15 minutes after the package eligibility time is set.
5. The action should be successful
6. Error should be displayed.
7. The patron with trait NODONOR should be able to relocate their seats 24 Hours after the package eligibility time is set.
8. The action should be successful

1.Set package.seat.relocation.features.enabled to true 
2.Create a Package with PLs associated and with the required permissions for Seat relocation.
3.Create a Patron without associating any membership program.
4.Create a loyalty program.
4.Create a GOLD level membership program and associate it with loyalty program.
5.Complete a sale transaction for the package with Patron .

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV
2. Associate the package with the membership program by navigating to the membership tab in the package.
3. Navigate to the Ticket services and select the above order.
4. Select Package Seat Relocation action from the Action drop down
5. Select the package lines for relocation  and click on apply changes
6. Lock new tickets for relocation
7. Complete the the checkout.
8. Navigate to Patron management select the patron and navigate to the membership tab
9. Verify that the membership status is updated appropriately.
10. Navigate to the loyalty tab of the patron and verify that loyalty points are added.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Login Should be successful
2. Membership program should be added to the package.
3. The ticket services page should be displayed
4. Package Seat Relocation action should be selected
5. User should be navigated to a relocation cart
6. New tickets should be locked
7. The checkout should be completed
8. The membership tab should be displayed.
9. The membership status should be updated appropriately. 
10. The loyalty tab of the patron and verify that loyalty points are added.

title: Verify default values of the options available in the new Self Service Full Package Seat Relocation block in AFP

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV application
2. Navigate to System Setup >> Application Feature Permissions
3. Set Permissions as "Market Permissions"
4. Set Agency Context
5. Check the parameters and its default values in Self Service Full Package Seat Relocation block
6. Check default value for all of them being â€œOnly Where Enabledâ€� except for 'Relocate Unpaid Orders' which will be defaulted to "Except where Disabled"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Log in successful
2. AFP page accessed successfully
3. "Market Permissions" settings to be displayed
4. Permissions set for the particular agency to be displayed
5. Result: 
a. New "Seat Relocation Settings" block should be available
b. Self Service Full Package Seat Relocation block is displayed successfully with the below options:
    1.Seat Relocation 
    2.Relocate Accessible Seats 
    3.Relocate Comp Tickets 
    4.Relocate Buyer Type Restriction
    5.Relocate Unpaid Orders
    6.Relocate Tickets More than once
6. Success
Each parameter having inherit checkbox and dropdown box with values
1.Never
2.Only where enabled 
3.Except where Disabled
Note:
Default value for all of them being â€œOnly Where Enabledâ€� except for 'Relocate Unpaid Orders' which will be defaulted to "Except where Disabled"

title: Verify whether order with exchanged tickets can be relocated for tickets with "full package activity" / cannot be relocated for tickets with "Partial package activity"
custom_preconds:
1. Property "package.seat.relocation.features.enabledâ€™ is set to true.
2. Create a Package with multiple Package event lists which are MASTER ONLY.
3. Set all the flags for relocation feature in Package and Package list access.
- 'Package Seat Relocation' to true in Package Access
- 'Package List Seat Relocation' to true in Package List Access
4. Package List Event Class is "Primary"
8. Complete transaction with Master event

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Login to PV application
2. Go to Ticket Services and search for the above order id
3. Select Exchange tickets action and select tickets from the package lists such that all lists still have at least 1 seat and complete it
4. Select Seat relocation action from action dropdown and select the tickets and see if its eligible for relocation
5. Complete the relocation transaction
6. Repeat the same for tickets with partial package activity for a new Master event order.
ie; Select Exchange tickets action and select tickets from only one package list and do not select tickets from second package list for exchange action
7. Select Seat relocation action from action dropdown and select the tickets and see if its eligible for relocation
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Log in successful
2. Ticket Services for searched Order is displayed
3. Exchange with full package activity is completed successfully.
4. Exchange tickets with full package activity order should be eligible for seat relocation
5. Relocation transaction should be successful.
6. Exchange should be successful
7. Exchange tickets with Partial package activity order should not be eligible for seat relocation
